speaker: GARY GARBER
line: You don't know how much I hate my job on days like this, Jeb. If it were my choice... … I'd be giving you a promotion but with the economy the way it is...

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Are you firing me?

speaker: GARY GARBER
line: You can hold your head up, Jeb. You've done a good job here.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I-I don't believe this. I... I thought this was just an evaluation.

speaker: GARY GARBER
line: I'm sorry. I really am.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Stay back. Everybody stay back. Just get back. Everybody stay back.

speaker: DISTRAUGHT WOMAN
line: Oh, my god, there's someone in there!

speaker: OFFICER
line: Stay back! Keep your distance.

speaker: ROBERTA TOEWS
line: Jeb. Can I help you? Jeb...

speaker: GARY GARBER
line: Hey... Jeb... What's up?

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, hi. Uh... Uh, Monica Reyes.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Frank Potter, New Orleans PD.

speaker: REYES
line: Trying to quit the habit.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Yeah, I tried to quit smoking myself once. I hated that damn gum.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Well, anyway you, uh, want to see the victims?

speaker: REYES
line: Well, on the phone you said you had reason to believe the killings might be satanic ritual murders.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Right. Let me show you.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: This is Jeb Dukes' work area. I found this among his personal effects.

speaker: REYES
line: What can you tell me about the killer, detective? Anything?

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Thirty-one years old. College grad, lived alone. There's some who felt he had a dark side which could explain that there.

speaker: REYES
line: Can I look in there?

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Sure. You're the expert.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Does it tell you anything about why he might've killed those people?

speaker: REYES
line: The fact is, a killer like this is usually pushed over the edge by what we call a stressor, a catalysing event-- an emotional breakdown the breakup of a relationship or sometimes when someone's been fired.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: This guy was fired … by the two victims.

speaker: REYES
line: Well, that's most likely what drove him to murder.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Yeah, but what about all these images... these devil pictures?

speaker: REYES
line: It's Marilyn Manson.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Marilyn Manson?

speaker: REYES
line: Your kids listen to him. They probably buy his CDs at K-Mart. I don't think there's anything satanic going on here, Detective.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Agent Reyes? Okay, okay... It's some rock group, but you don't think this has anything to do with Satan or evil or...?

speaker: REYES
line: Personally? I'd look into his gum.

speaker: DETECTIVE POTTER
line: Agent Reyes? Did you find something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just about to jump in the shower but I was waiting for the pizza man.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got something going on with the pizza man I should know about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The pizza man?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, correct me if I'm wrong but you just said you were waiting for the pizza man to jump in the shower.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, what I mean was the pizza man's usually late, and so...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You want to come in?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I feel like I'm stuck in an episode of Mad About You.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, uh, yeah, but small technicality. Mad About You was about a married couple and we just work together.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, well, you know what I'm talking about.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do, I do. What-what I'm trying to say is that, uh... we have no good reliable information on this man. I mean, what I am saying is the pizza man...

speaker: MULDER
line: … is not above suspicion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ah, I see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that for me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nice package.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's the occasion?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, uh, I was going through some stuff after my mother died and, um, it's just an old family keepsake and I wanted you to have it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I'm touched.

speaker: MULDER
line: Little Caesar, I presume?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi... just, uh, give it to the man with the funny look on his face.

speaker: PIMPLY-FACED PIZZA DELIVERY MAN
line: Yeah, it's $29.08.

speaker: MULDER
line: $29.08? What'd she get on it, a tank of gas?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully!

speaker: MULDER
line: Call 911.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: That Scully? Dana? She's got what? Abdominal pains?

speaker: MULDER
line: Her doctor is Dr. Speake.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Oh, he's been called.

speaker: MULDER
line: She.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Who are you? The husband?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Then you wait outside.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Mulder, what happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you find out?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I was dropping something off. The landlord told me.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Are you the husband?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: REYES
line: Special Agent Fox Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Speaking.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Mulder, my name is Monica Reyes. We never met. Not since you've been alive, I should say.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: REYES
line: Special Agent Reyes. I know this is out of the blue, but I have a case I need your help on. It involves a certain phenomenon.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't help you, Agent Reyes, for so many reasons. I think you should contact Agent Doggett at the X-Files.

speaker: REYES
line: I can't call Agent Doggett because it involves him.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm in New Orleans, but I can be in DC in a few hours. It's important, Agent Mulder. Very.

speaker: MULDER
line: Call me when you get here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They're telling us not to worry. They're running some tests.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Reyes?

speaker: REYES
line: You're taller than I thought.

speaker: MULDER
line: You keep on alluding to a time that we've met and I don't remember.

speaker: REYES
line: I was there when they found you in the woods. You were...

speaker: REYES
line: Uh... Yeah. I'm not surprised you don't remember.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Um, I-I have somewhere I have to be … if we could cut to the chase.

speaker: REYES
line: As I said before, it involves Agent Doggett … the death his son. I don't know if you're familiar at all with that case.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm not at all familiar with Agent Doggett.

speaker: AKA
line: Unknown Child is suspected to have been … MULDER scans the information. He looks at another picture, crime scene photo of LUKE DOGGETT lying dead, face down on the ground. There is sympathy in MULDER's voice.)

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I wasn't aware of this. You were the lead investigator?

speaker: REYES
line: Once it fell to the FBI. Agent Doggett was with the NYPD at the time. We worked it together. We never caught the killer. It was the hardest case I've ever had. As in stealing-into-the-bathroom-to-cry-my-eyes-out kind of hard. I can't begin to imagine what it was like for John.

speaker: REYES
line: I couldn't bear to put him through this again, but if it means we could catch his son's killer... I just can't go to him until I know if what I saw means anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said this case involves some kind of phenomenon?

speaker: REYES
line: I don't know if it was a psychic experience or what, but when we found his son, I had a vision. It was as if for just a moment... The body was changed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Changed? Into what?

speaker: REYES
line: Ashes. It looked like ashes. The thing of it is Agent Doggett told me he saw it, too … although he spent the last few years convincing himself he didn't, that even if he did, it didn't mean anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think it means?

speaker: REYES
line: I can't shake the feeling that it's a clue, that it could somehow point to who's responsible, if only I let it. And now I've seen it again. A thousand miles from here, a seemingly unrelated case and I've had the same vision. There has to be a reason for it, a reason it's happening now.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Sir, immediate family only. You fellas just don't listen. You have to go now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey! Hey!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You stay out of my life!

speaker: MULDER
line: Take it easy!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You stay out of my business!

speaker: MULDER
line: Take it easy, Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You want to get something on me, you ask for it! I don't want to get calls about you going behind my back! You got that straight?!

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't want anything on you. I was asked to look into this file.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Who asked you?!

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Doggett. What are you doing?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Is this you? Is this you looking into this?

speaker: REYES
line: Yes. I asked Agent Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You asked him what? There's nothing in there for him to bother with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you just calm down, Agent Doggett and let her explain the connection to you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The connection? To what?

speaker: REYES
line: I was going to tell you, John. I was in New Orleans on a case-- a shooting. Something that I saw connected back to Luke. A vision.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not this again. You're not going to make something out of nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bob Harvey. Does that name mean something or nothing to you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Bob Harvey was a suspect in the death of my son. We questioned him but then we realized he wasn't our man.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Mulder pointed it out. Bob Harvey was killed last night in a car crash fleeing the police near a shooting in New Orleans. He died in front of the building where the shooting occurred.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the connection?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That's it?

speaker: REYES
line: And then there was the vision.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, there's no connection. I don't care what you saw, you leave it alone … … and you leave it the hell alone.

speaker: REYES
line: I know there is something here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good.

speaker: REYES
line: Hi.

speaker: MIA
line: Hi.

speaker: REYES
line: Is your Mommy home?

speaker: MIA
line: Mom!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Mia?

speaker: REYES
line: Katha Dukes?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Yeah.

speaker: REYES
line: Sorry about the late hour. My name is Monica Reyes. I'm with the FBI.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: I believe that we're all born good, uncorrupted and life itself does the corrupting. But, you know, someone like Jeb... He just isn't capable of this.

speaker: REYES
line: Are you close... to your brother?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Very. Jeb lived here in the house with us till he went down South. He loves his niece.

speaker: REYES
line: Does the name Bob Harvey mean anything to you? Did Jeb ever have any dealings with him?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: No. I think I'd know. Why?

speaker: REYES
line: No reason. It's the answer I was kind of expecting, actually.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Hello? SPARTANBURG, SOUTH CAROLINA OFF INTERSTATE 85

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Katha?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Yes?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Katha, it's Jeb.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: I really can't talk right now. It's been a very bad day here.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Listen, it wasn't me that killed those people, all right? It was somebody else. I'm telling you, it was somebody else.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: You're going to have to call back later.

speaker: PAYPHONE WOMAN
line: Hi. I'm sorry to bother you. I got a flat tire back a ways.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I was, um... I just came by to see how you're doing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm, uh... I feel all druggy. Do you mind?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They say you're stabilized but we've been worried about you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's we?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know... me and Agent Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's wrong, Agent Doggett? You don't seem too good yourself.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You worked with Agent Mulder for how long? A long time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You never believed in any of this stuff. This paranormal or whatever you call it. So, what changed your mind?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I realized it was me, that I was afraid. Afraid to believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why do you ask?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Doggett, why do you ask?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Some other time.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Mulder? I was looking for Agent Doggett.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that'd make sense. It's not my office anymore but old habits die hard.

speaker: REYES
line: What are those?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cases involving images like you described. People close to crimes who experience visions of death disassociated from reality.

speaker: REYES
line: And what did you find?

speaker: MULDER
line: Absolutely nothing. These visions are so random as to have absolutely no significance to the cases they're supposed to pertain to.

speaker: REYES
line: You're wrong.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I know these files.

speaker: REYES
line: And I know what I saw. There's a reason these things are happening. There is something at work here, and it all began with the man killed in the car crash-- Bob Harvey.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that's a coincidence. I think that life is full of them.

speaker: REYES
line: And full of patterns things we see, but can't comprehend. You believe that. Why can't you believe this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think there's an opening coming up in this office soon. You might want to apply.

speaker: REYES
line: Is that why you won't help him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a, uh, sick friend in the hospital and, uh, I think I should go see her.

speaker: REYES
line: I hope she gets well. This office down here needs at least one person with an open mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: You'll say anything, won't you?

speaker: REYES
line: Only when I think I'm right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What am I doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Been asking myself that same question, Agent Doggett. But it seems the tenacious Agent Reyes does not want to let go of this one.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: She's got a murder victim out here, a woman found shot. She thinks it's probably the same man who killed those two people down in New Orleans-- this Jeb Dukes.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What does she want from me?

speaker: MULDER
line: She wants to know if you see it, too. What she's been seeing.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I told you, there's no connection.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Doggett.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm sorry, Agent Reyes. I don't see it.

speaker: REYES
line: I think you do.

speaker: REYES
line: You're just afraid to go there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoo. You just keep shooting till you hit something, don't you?

speaker: REYES
line: You'd rather blind yourself to the connections, but I can't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You keep talking about these connections. Connections to what? To who?

speaker: REYES
line: What if this is a thread of evil … connecting through time through men, through opportunity, connecting back to you. In India, in Africa, in Iran, in the Middle East, in the Far East. Most of the world, they take it as a given. They see evil in death the way other people see God in a rose.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw Elvis in a potato chip once.

speaker: REYES
line: You know what I'm talking about.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, I do. I do. But if this man doesn't see it, he doesn't see it, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: You awake?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: What did the doctor say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That I had a partial abruption. Which means that my placenta started to tear away from the uterine wall. They're going to need to monitor me for awhile.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you're going to be fine?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where have you been?

speaker: MULDER
line: I've actually been out in the field with Agent Doggett and this, um, female Agent from New Orleans.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Reyes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I like her.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're nothing at all alike.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then neither are you and I. So this is a case you're working on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Actually, one that involves Agent Doggett's son, the son who died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, he's never talked to me about him, but I know something. Are you able to help him at all?

speaker: MULDER
line: You can't help a man who can't help himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's worth the effort, Mulder.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: All right, you got a half an hour to play in your room before mommy has dinner ready. Mia?

speaker: MIA
line: Okay.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: What are you doing here?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I'm coming home.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: The FBI was here, Jeb.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I didn't do what they said, Kath. It wasn't me, okay? It wasn't.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: What is that on your face?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: What?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Is that blood?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I don't know how that got there.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: I need the truth, Jeb.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Look, please, believe me, Katha, it's not me, okay? I need help, please.

speaker: MIA
line: Mom? Is that uncle Jeb?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Yeah, sweetheart. Yeah, it is.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: It's me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Jeb Dukes, middle name, Larold. No, Larold. Okay, thanks, anyway.

speaker: REYES
line: What are you doing, John?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm looking into this case.

speaker: REYES
line: You're looking in the wrong way. There are a hundred agents in this building who can phone canvass.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ah, but there's only two who can solve crimes with mental telepathy-- you and me. So we'll just read the tea leaves on this one and there it is, right? Case closed?

speaker: REYES
line: John...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Damn it, Monica, you want to find this guy. I'm trying to find him. What do you want from me?

speaker: REYES
line: I want you to be honest with yourself about what you saw that day. Honest about what your feelings tell you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Feelings don't solve crimes. What the hell does it matter what my feelings are? How the hell's that going to get the job done?

speaker: REYES
line: I'm not talking about the job, John. What are you scared of? Why does it scare you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got to believe that I did everything I could to find my son.

speaker: REYES
line: You did do everything to find your son.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got to believe that I did everything I could to save him, to get him back safe, to not let him down. I got to believe that I did everything humanly possible 'cause if I can't believe that then these other possibilities that you talk about, that Mulder talks about, that Agent Scully talks about... if they're real... if they're real, then... that's something else I could have done to save my son.

speaker: REYES
line: Monica Reyes. Katha? Katha, wait.

speaker: REYES
line: Jeb Dukes' sister. He's there at the house with her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This guy somehow has some link to my son and I'm damn sure going to find out what it is.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: "As it happened, Hansel and Gretel had overheard everything that their parents had said. 'Shh,' said the boy. 'I'll find a way out, I promise you, and when at last...'"

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Mia, honey? Can you come here a minute, please?

speaker: MIA
line: But uncle Jeb's reading to me.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: That's okay, I just need you a minute. Can you, can you just come here?

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Who's here?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: She just wants to talk, Jeb. I just want you to tell her what you told me. She can help you.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Who? I said who, damn it!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Come on, baby.

speaker: MIA
line: Uncle Jeb!

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: You lied to me!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Come on, Jeb.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Just get back.

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy!

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: Go!

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy! Mommy! Let me go, Uncle Jeb! Mommy, help! Let me go, let me go, help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right there, right there! Hands in the air! Federal Agent, I'm armed, I'll shoot!

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: You drop the gun, you drop the gun!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let her go!

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy!

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I'll shoot her, I swear!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I just need to talk to you.

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy... Mommy, mommy!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I won't hurt you.

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: You stay back.

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy! Mommy!

speaker: JEB DUKES
line: I said stay back!

speaker: MIA
line: Mommy! Mommy!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Mia, Mia!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: What have you done?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This man needs help!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're not going to die on me now.

speaker: REYES
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You hear me? You're going to make it. You're going to make it. You hear me?

speaker: REYES
line: John!

speaker: ER NURSE
line: No, no, the parade stops here. Now, if you want to save him, let the doctors do their work, okay? Who's the immediate family member here?

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: I am.

speaker: ER NURSE
line: Okay, come with me. I'm going to need you to fill out some information for me, all right?

speaker: REYES
line: There is nothing more you can do.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You can't tell me that now.

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe saving this girl was the reason. Maybe that's what this was all about. Maybe that's what I saw and why I saw it. For *that* kid. Go home, John. There's nothing here for you to do.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Doggett...

speaker: MULDER
line: She just fell back to sleep.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I just wanted to check to see how she's doing. Anyways, I'm here with this other thing. We, uh, we caught this killer, Jeb Dukes. He's in the ICU. He may not make it.

speaker: MULDER
line: And now you're wondering if there really was a connection. You know, when I, uh... I first came to work at the FBI, I worked at Violent Crimes, and I saw, I saw the worst of humanity. I saw monsters and I wondered how they became that way, how these men became so evil. I know there were psychological explanations-- victims of their environment, victims of their parents-- but the scientific explanations were never truly satisfying. And I began to think about evil like, like a disease. You know, that it goes from man to man or age to age. Most of us walk around thinking we're incapable of any acts of evil and we are. You know, we can stifle that momentary urge to kill or to hurt. We have some kind of immunity to it. But I think it's possible that there's... an occurrence in somebody's life, a tragedy or a loss that leaves them vulnerable, hurts their immunity to evil, and all of a sudden at that point in their lives when they're weakened, they're open to evil and they can become evil.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If that were true, then what you're saying is... is that this man we wheeled in here tonight is infected with evil, the same evil that killed my son. You really believe that, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, I'm not really a good test for questions like that. I'll believe almost anything, you know, but the, uh... the pisser is you may never know. It may be like Agent Reyes says. It could be random and meaningless-- who it affects, who it goes to.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What if it isn't?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then you'd be seeing something that I don't, Agent Doggett.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: Somebody!

speaker: REYES
line: Doctor!

speaker: DR. SPEAKE
line: Push one gram of epi.

speaker: NURSE
line: Right here.

speaker: DR. SPEAKE
line: Call it.

speaker: DR. SPEAKE
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: NURSE
line: Time of death: 10:57 P.M.

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: No, no, no...

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: You killed him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Drop the weapon!

speaker: KATHA DUKES
line: No!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Drop it!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I need a doctor!

speaker: DR. SPEAKE
line: Oh, my Lord.

speaker: NURSE
line: Get a doctor in here stat.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's over. It's over now.

speaker: REYES
line: It's never over.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you never fail to surprise me. I just wish I felt like eating it right now.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's cool. We can just wait for the cheese to congeal and eat it later.

speaker: MULDER
line: You miss your regular pizza man, don't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. That's okay. He's coming by later.

speaker: MULDER
line: I bet you forgot about that, didn't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I didn't, actually. I thought about it a lot while I was lying in my hospital bed wondering what on earth you could have given me.

speaker: MULDER
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god. Oh, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is it what you imagined?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not even close.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, my, that's the wrong doll, actually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But then that's the other gift that you gave me, Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Courage... to believe. And I hope that's a gift I can pass on.
